Reviews.Title: “Not helpfull at all.”
Reviews.Author: Rockdog2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed in space #138. Worst space in the park, in order to level our MH we had to raise front tire 6" off the ground. Our neighbors had to leave on an emergency and we asked to move to that spot, they told us they had already rented it. No one showed up. The spot is next to restroom where kids ride bikes on the side walk like a speed way. Will not go back!

Reviews.Title: “PARKING LOT NIGHTMARE !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1Taiko
Reviews.Content: What a TRAILER PARK dump, They abuse the use of RESORT. This place is nothing more than a blacktop lot with white lines to squeeze your coach in. When we're ready to leave, we're going to need to ask three rv's across from us to move so we can pull our 45' coach out using a shoe horn. They weren't here when we arrived. I SHOULD HAVE READ THE REVIEWS BEFORE SELECTING THIS DUMP. We love San Diego, but will look for somewhere else to stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Affordable, Clean and Fun Rv Resort”
Reviews.Author: AprilChino
Reviews.Content: We went to Mission Bay RV Resort for the first time recently and loved it! We normally stay at Campland which is across the bay, but the spots we like were full and the ones available were outragously priced. I had checked out this campgrounds reviews and decided to try it and was pleasently surprised!! First off this Resort does not allow tent camping which is a huge plus...We got a Bay View site which is a little more pricy but well worth it. The resort is a lot smaller than Campland but is very clean and staff is very friendly. It has a Snack Shack ,does movies for the kids at night and has access to the bay and water activities.There is no store or pool on site which is a bummer but we survived,lol. The people that we met there were great many had been coming for 10 plus years which says a lot about the resort! This resort is a lot quieter than campland which is nice, we could hear them across the bay.But it is not stuffy we are a young family of 5 with 3 kids all over the age of 9 and had no problems at all! The kids rode bikes, fished, kayaked and got to watch Seaworld's firework show every nite, as we had the perfect view. When quiet time rolled around no one was rudly being told to shut everything down like some campgrounds do which was nice and no one was being disrespectfuly loud either which was great!! Overall we had a great experience and will definitly be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Bring Some Earplugs”
Reviews.Author: deuce840
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this campground each summer, for the past five summers. Why I keep subjecting my family to the same punishment is a mystery. This last trip we intentionally visited weekday in an attempt to miss the crowd. No such luck. The place was about 80% capacity, mostly with groups that knew each other. We somehow got stuck in the middle of a loud group who seemed to be on Hawaii time zone. Quiet times were not observed or enforced and like a bar, it didn't get quiet until around 2 am. I had to put earplugs in and run the A/C for white noise. The WiFi for some reason ALWAYS locks up my devices. I will say that the staff is friendly, the park is secure, clean and maintained pretty well. It's also pretty close to quite a few attractions. But if you're looking for some peace and quiet when you return from a day of sightseeing, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “they let neighbors move in at 3:10 am? so if you don't mind not sleeping its nice”
Reviews.Author: numberonerep
Reviews.Content: it is a giant black-top, but that was ok.. you can just walk to the bay, but the way they have the rows set up with no walk-ways - people just walk through your sight. that's ok too.. it was the neighbor totally cranking up his leveling blocks and moving everything around and shining all his lights at 3:10.. I think if you weren't near this space you probably had a nice time, but I paid extra for bay view, strain your neck.. they said quiet time was 11 pm.. the people moving and making a huge racket.. hooking up and all that is not a sleepy time thing. so from 3:10 to 4:30 we had that going on, and then everybody else woke up at 6:30.. not a relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “I guess you have to take the bad with the good.”
Reviews.Author: rickysmom
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say that this is my 3rd consecutive year staying here. On the good side, it is a great place if you have children. The property is (mostly) fenced in and children of all ages ride around on bikes, skateboards, scooters and anything else they can find. The mgmt. shows movies on Saturday nights. The beach area is waveless and safe. It is a much quieter place than Campland on the Bay which is close by and can be heard across the water at night. The negatives are that the property is basically a giant asphalt parking lot with very little distance between spaces and no privacy. Because the area is safe, many parents let their kids run wild and more than once I've had to tell children that my campsite is not their play area. The mgmt. advertises internet access. It is poor at best. Each year they claim it's new and improved and each year it is crappy. They also claim to have cable tv. Of the 18 or so channels listed as available, I get 6 and most are the quality of an old school aerial antenna. The previous 2 years, I had a spot on the entrance road of the facility. The adults were noisier than the kids late at night. This year I moved over the southernmost row and have found it quiet and peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing...great amenities!”
Reviews.Author: fabfam6
Reviews.Content: Reasonable rates; friendly, helpful staff; beautiful location; will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “This is a family park with great activities for all”
Reviews.Author: mulsalgado
Reviews.Content: This is a great place, very clean and safe. WiFi seems excellent ( Im on it now writing review) Extra large paved campsites which makes it great to spread out. Will add this to our regular campground spots

Reviews.Title: “New owners, new rules”
Reviews.Author: wintertraveler22
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in this rv park several years ago, and while it isn't very glamorous, we did enjoy being right next to the water, could sit by the big windows & see all the water birds in the morning. It cost a little more, but we felt it was worth it. Here's what you should check out ahead of time. When I called back about a month ago to reserve a spot for next winter, we were told we could not, under any circumstances, pull our motor home into a "bay view" space - had to back in. This would put our bedroom next to the bay - not much view there. We should pay extra for that?????? Found another park next to the water that is more flexible. And, for a 5th wheel it would probably be fine. The best thing about it is the location in relation to all the attractions in San Diego. Very east to get to anything.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointment”
Reviews.Author: rocklady41
Reviews.Content: Mission Bay Rv Resort is not a Resort of any kind. It is a slab of cement and just a place to park. The rates are far to high for what is offered. Electricity, Sub-standard Cable, WiFi when working, A Laundry room that only one person can stand in. For 259 sites and only 4 washers and 4 dryers. Zero site privacy. The staff was kurt to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised, great RV Park”
Reviews.Author: Panther_91719
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was pleasantly surprised with the campground. After reading the one other review on here I was a little worried. To some extend, yes this is a large fenced in parking lot, but for it's location I have to say "what is to be expected". Also this is definitely not a resort with amenities and such but is a great place to stay for a few days when in the San Diego area. The campground was very clean, bathrooms clean also (if needed), RV parking seemed adequate, the front desk staff was very polite and helpful and the beach, which is right outside the campground, is very nice with a large sand beach, a small launch ramp for Jet Skiâ€™s or small boats. The water was very calm and clean, it is in the bay and there was very little power boat activity which was nice and quiet and also there were people with little kids out in the water kayaking around the area. There is also a rental facility with Kayaks, Jet skiâ€™s and powerboat right on the beach. We also took our bikes and itâ€™s a 10 minute ride around the whole place so it is not very large and you can also ride right down the street to a VERY large City park with plenty of grass that is on the waters edge with Sand beaches as well. Overall it was a very nice place to stay and we will definitely visit again. It was very quiet at night and they had a movie for the kids on Saturday night. One thing to note is that there is no store at the RV park other than a small snack bar with food icecream and does sell ice and there also in no food restarants or stores within walking distance of the RV park.

HotelInfo.Name: Mission Bay RV Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 2727 De Anza Rd, San Diego, CA
